Great, studying the automotive sector in Malaysia is a worthwhile endeavor given the country's increasing focus on sustainable development and the growth of the automotive industry in the region. Here are some potential areas of focus for your study:

1. Environmental regulations: It may be useful to analyze the impact of environmental regulations on the automotive industry in Malaysia, and how companies are adapting to meet these regulations. For example, Malaysia has set a target of having 30% of its vehicles running on electric power by 2030. It would be interesting to study how companies are responding to this target and what their plans are for meeting it.
2. Renewable energy adoption: As part of its sustainable development goals, Malaysia has also set a target of increasing its renewable energy capacity to 20% of its electricity generation mix by 2025. It would be interesting to study how automotive companies in Malaysia are adopting renewable energy sources and how this impacts their financial performance.
3. Consumer demand: It may also be useful to analyze how consumer demand for sustainable products is affecting the automotive industry in Malaysia. For example, are consumers willing to pay a premium for electric vehicles or other sustainable automotive products? How are companies responding to this demand?
4. Financial metrics: As with any study of sustainability and stock performance, it will be important to analyze relevant financial metrics for the automotive companies being studied. These may include revenue growth, profitability, cost of capital, and other relevant financial indicators.

Overall, studying the automotive sector in Malaysia through the lens of sustainability and stock performance could provide valuable insights into how companies in this industry are responding to environmental and social pressures, and what impact this is having on their financial performance.
